intro: Dorstenia convexa var. convexa, commonly known as the convex stemmed dorstenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, fleshy, and often ribbed stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and ornamental stems make it a popular choice for indoor cultivation.
